item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Weekend hot take on data analysis metrics: the NFL's passer rating means well, but is a hot uninterpretable mess. There's a great opportunity here for sabermetricians to come up with something better.

item.title: Tendar
item.description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu has won the 2nd and final round of the presidential elections. She is leading by almost 7 percentage points with 96.9% of all counted votes and cannot be overtaken by her opponent, even when he gets all remaining votes. The Russian influence and infiltration campaign didn't pay of. Moldovans have chosen that path to the West and the EU.Congratulations, Maia Sandu.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: US citizens: Please vote. It matters. Even if youâ€™re in a state where the presidential vote is lopsided, your vote matters. Local matters need your vote.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Dots are clinics. Darker colors are counties that are further from a clinic. There is no safe way to insert politicians and government officials into hard healthcare decisions. I trust women and doctors. Everyone should have help and care nearby. Letâ€™s get to work and make things better.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: California has an excellent votersâ€™ guide https://voterguide.sos.ca.gov plainly worded, statements from candidates, arguments for and against measures, fact checked, budget analysisâ€¦ and in a bunch of different languages. Thereâ€™s room for improving how California is governed, but our voter guide is well done. Do other states do it well too?

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Big paper from the International Brain Lab group: https://elifesciences.org/reviewed-preprints/100840 One takeaway is that using stereotaxic coordinates involves variance which "... is sizeable enough to impact probe targeting to desired brain regions and poses a limit on the resolution of probe targeting." Lots of labs do posthoc histology verification, which can help.Functional targeting is my favorite. Here's a figure from the supplement to one of our preprints. Functional targeting is way better than using skull landmarks. https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.08.27.555017v1

item.title: Taylor Lorenz
item.description: The official Twitter account of the GOP House Judiciary Committee posted about Peanut. Elon Musk posted and reposted over 20 tweets about Peanut throughout the weekend. The Wall Street Journal ran an opinion piece decrying Peanut's death as an example of "abusive government" and tried to tie the incident to crime on New York City subways and Democrat-run government. And right wing crypto accounts have begun boosting a forthcoming Peanut meme coin. https://www.usermag.co/p/how-an-ig-famous-squirrel-became

item.title: Elia Ayoub (he/him)
item.description: #Israel -i soldiers play around in a destroyed home in south #Lebanon. The owner of the piano saw the video and shared a video she took of herself playing the soundtrack of The Pianist, the holocaust movie.

item.title: Beth Cimini
item.description:
If women gave up every time we got evidence people hate us or just don't even consider us people, nothing would ever get done.
So take a minute, feel/"honor" the awful feelings, because they're real, but then we're back to our regularly scheduled program of building the least-worst world we can.

item.title: myrmepropagandist
item.description: @Extra_Special_Carbon But people wrote stories and made art, they named SO MANY bugs and discovered so much about how nature worksâ€” they had families and remarkable lives in spite of all of that and you and I will do that too. Powerful men will thump their clubs. Maybe we arenâ€™t the kind of animals that can transcend that. I still kind of think we are, though. Because like a bit of grit in an oyster I wonâ€™t go away or stop being irritating. No. I will become a pearl.
